Acid Solution.name: Acid Solution
Acid Solution.effect:
2d6 damage to any living creature it is thrown on and does 1d6/2 ablation damage to weapons and armor.

Throwing it is an Athletics attack with a range equal to your BODYx2m, and the acid splatters in a 2m cone directly away from where it lands.

Adda’s Tomb.name: Adda’s Tomb
Adda’s Tomb.effect: Treated perishables will not begin to rot or spoil for 1d10 days. Preserving a human-sized body requires 2 doses.

Adrenal Elixir.name: Adrenal Elixir
Adrenal Elixir.effect:
Lowers the DC to stabilize the imbiber in Death State by 5 and bolsters their chances of survival. For the next 3 Rounds, the target automatically succeeds at Death Saves, though their Death Save penalty continues to rise.

If imbibed while not in Death State, the Adrenal Elixir allows the imbiber to ignore the penalties of being below their Wound Threshold for three rounds.

Alchemical Adhesive.name: Alchemical Adhesive
Alchemical Adhesive.effect:
After 2 rounds the solution will harden, permanently sticking objects together, and sticking people to one another or to objects. The objects must be pried apart with a DC:16 Physique check.

Throwing it is an Athletics attack with a range equal to your BODYx2m.

Alchemy Set.name: Alchemy Set
Alchemy Set.description: Allows you to craft alchemical items

Alcohest.name: Alcohest
Alcohest.description:
If you drink a bottle of alcohest it will poison you and intoxicate you. Once poisoned it takes a DC:16 Endurance check to shake off the poisoning. Even afterwards you will 
still be intoxicated for a number of hours equal to 12 inus your Body. Intoxication can be treated with wives’ ears potion.

Alp.name: Alp
Alp.minorMutation: a patchwork of dark red veins   under your skin

Anabolic Steroids.name: Anabolic Steroids
Anabolic Steroids.effect: Drinking Anabolic Steroids gives a character +10 maximum Hit Points, and +2 to Endurance and Physique for 10 minutes. On the other hand, it makes the drinker incredibly aggressive towards everyone for 1 hour.

Arachas Decoction.name: Arachas Decoction
Arachas Decoction.effect: For every 10 points of ENC you have free you gain +2 SP to all locations.

Ashen Ointment.name: Ashen Ointment
Ashen Ointment.effect: Spread across a character’s whole body, Ashen Ointment renders the character immune to the Fire Condition for 1 hour.

Bag of Marbles.name: Bag of Marbles
Bag of Marbles.description: Covers a 2m area. Anyone passing through it must beat a DC:14 Athletics check or be knocked prone. Quadrupedal creatures must only beat a DC:12 Athletics and creatures without legs are unaffected.

Bandolier.name: Bandolier
Bandolier.description: 25kg of tiny items, or larger items hooked onto it

Base Powder.name: Base Powder
Base Powder.effect: Counteracts the effects of acid, negating one dose of acid solution per dose of base powder used. Base powder can also negate damage from a torn stomach critical wound.

Berserker’s Brew.name: Berserker’s Brew
Berserker’s Brew.effect: When consumed, a target must make an Endurance check at DC:16. If they fail, they must use their turn to attack the closest person. Each round at the beginning of their turn, the target can attempt another Endurance check DC:16. If they succeed, the frenzy subsides until their next turn, at which point they must make the Endurance check again or fall back into the frenzy. Berseker’s Brew lasts 1d10 rounds.

Bizant.name: Bizant
Bizant.description:
= 4 Redanian Crowns
Used in Kovir & Poviss

Black Blood.name: Black Blood
Black Blood.effect: The witcher’s blood poisons any creature that drinks it, doing 3 points of damage per round until an Endurance check, DC:20 is made. The creature is also forced to recoil 2m.

Black Magic Doll.name: Black Magic Doll
Black Magic Doll.description:
A doll infused with dark magic to replicate a specific Low Danger Hex. A character holding a Black Magic Doll, can take a full round action to cut their hand (dealing 10 points of damage to themselves), bleed onto the doll, and roll a Curse Weaving check against the Resist Magic check of a target they truly hate. If the character succeeds, they inflict the Hex associated with the doll on the target.


Education DC:14 to determine nature.

Black Venom.name: Black Venom
Black Venom.effect:
Poisons a target if it gets into their bloodstream or is ingested. A DC:16 Endurance check ends the effect, but the target can become poisoned again if they consume more black venom or are cut by a poisoned weapon.

To coat a blade with black venom requires a full round and the weapon remains poisoned for 1d10 rounds. In drinks, it takes a DC:16 Awareness check to realize the drink is poisoned.

Blizzard.name: Blizzard
Blizzard.effect: +4 Reflex after killing an enemy. Further kills do not add to the bonus, which lasts until the potion duration ends.

Bonding Pair.name: Bonding Pair
Bonding Pair.description:
This item always comes in a set of 2 rings. When a wearer turns the ring in a specific sequence around their ring finger, they can speak a few words, roughly twenty, to be carried on the wind to the wearer of the other ring. The message always reaches its destination in less than a day, but the exact amount of time depends on distance and is left to the Game Master.

Additionally, the rings vibrate when one of the wearers is in mortal danger regardless of the distance between the two.

Education DC:16 to determine nature.

Book of Tales.name: Book of Tales
Book of Tales.description: A book of folk tales and legends which automatically eveals the Commoner Superstition of any monster when referenced. Additionally, it grants a +1 to any Monster Lore checks made while referencing the book.

Bredan’s Fury.name: Bredan’s Fury
Bredan’s Fury.effect: Explodes when exposed to air, doing 2d6 damage to every body location of any creature within 2m. Throwing it is a an Athletics attack with a range equal to your BODYx2m.

Bullvore.name: Bullvore
Bullvore.minorMutation: Hard growths all over the body

Cadaverine Solution.name: Cadaverine Solution
Cadaverine Solution.effect: A slashing or piercing weapon coated in Cadaverine inflicts both the poisoned and nauseated conditions on a target on a successfully damaging attack. Two separate (DC:16) Endurance checks must be made to end  both conditions.

Camouflage Cloak.name: Camouflage Cloak
Camouflage Cloak.description: By taking a minute, a character can gather foliage from the local environment to weave through the loops on the cloak. While the cloak is fitted this way, the character wearing it gains a +1 to Stealth checks in that wilderness.

Candle.name: Candle
Candle.description: Raises light levels by 1 for 2m all around. High wind blows it out.

Cat.name: Cat
Cat.effect: No penalties for darkness or dim light. You also cannot be hypnotised, and gain a +2 to see through illusions.

Cavalry Saddle.name: Cavalry Saddle
Cavalry Saddle.description:
+1 to Control checks for attacking
Built-in sheath for a weapon

Celestine.name: Celestine
Celestine.effect: Consuming a dose of Celestine causes the target to hallucinate colorful lights and pleasant sounds. This makes focusing difficult and imposes a -2 penalty to Awareness and any other task that requires focus. This condition ends in 2d10 minutes but a DC:14 Endurance check ends the condition early.

Centerpiece.name: Centerpiece
Centerpiece.description: An entirely unique item crafted for the purposes of protecting a person from a casglydd. This item can take many forms and you will never see the same item more than once. This item must be crafted by a skilled artisan and must be incredibly complex. This complexity can come in the form of intricate carvings or embroidery, strange shapes and angles, puzzle elements, hidden compartments, or the like. This item must be wrapped up and presented to the casglydd when they are summoned. Upon giving the Centerpiece to the casglydd the demon shifts its fascination from you to the Centerpiece. The casglydd will not attach to you and reoccur even if you sign a contract with it.

Cerebral Elixir.name: Cerebral Elixir
Cerebral Elixir.effect: An elixir composed of hallucinogen infused with mandrake root, hellebore petals, crow’s eye, wolfsbane, and feline brain matter macerated in alcohest. The concoction must be filtered through han fiber and mixed with silver shavings. The elixir must be consumed at the beginning of the summoning ritual. The Elixir lasts for 24 hours and while under its effects if you cannot be possessed by a bes. If you manage to drink this Elixir while possessed by a bes, the bes is immediately forced out of your body.
Cerebral Elixir.description: An elixir composed of hallucinogen infused with mandrake root, hellebore petals, crow’s eye, wolfsbane, and feline brain matter macerated in alcohest. The concoction must be filtered through han fiber and mixed with silver shavings. The elixir must be consumed at the beginning of the summoning ritual. The Elixir lasts for 24 hours and while under its effects if you cannot be possessed by a bes. If you manage to drink this Elixir while possessed by a bes, the bes is immediately forced out of your body.

Chain Barding.name: Chain Barding
Chain Barding.description:
SP: 15 to your whole mount
-1 to Control checks for Riding

Chloroform.name: Chloroform
Chloroform.effect: Forces anyone who breathes it to make a Stun save at -2 or be knocked unconcious until they do make the save. Using it usually requires a Melee attack with a cloth soaked in the chloroform. It can also be poured into a vessel. Each bottle contains 25 doses.

Clotting Powder.name: Clotting Powder
Clotting Powder.effect: Stops the bleeding effect for 2d10 rounds. After the rounds elapse the wound begins bleeding again. You can then apply  another dose.

Coin Splitter.name: Coin Splitter
Coin Splitter.description: A tool which can be used to split a coin in half and restamp the blank side. By taking 30 minutes, a character with Coin Splitter can take up to 100 crowns and split them, creating double the number of coins. These coins are thinner but this can only be determined with a DC 18 Perception check. If a character has a set of Merchant’s Tools they can use the included scale to automatically know the coins have been split.

Concealed Chest.name: Concealed Chest
Concealed Chest.description: A wooden chest concealed in another object such a statue or a piece of furniture. The chest can carry up to 30kg of Tiny or Small items and any observer must make a DC:18 Perception check to realize that the object has a compartment.

Cover: Camouflage.name: Cover: Camouflage
Cover: Camouflage.description: By taking an action, a character can unroll a woven mat of foliage and fake plant life over the Wagon. In a wilderness environment, as long as the wagon is detached from its animals and not moving, a character must make a DC:16 Awareness check to spot the wagon from a distance using sight.

Cover: Cover Railing.name: Cover: Cover Railing
Cover: Cover Railing.description: Allows the cover of the wagon to be raised and lowered as an action.

Cover: Steel Top.name: Cover: Steel Top
Cover: Steel Top.description: Provides total cover to anyone inside the Wagon. This cover has 20 SP but does not increase the SP of the vehicle itself.

Crafting Tools.name: Crafting Tools
Crafting Tools.description: Allows you to craft weapons & armor

Crystal Skull.name: Crystal Skull
Crystal Skull.description:
A crystallized animal skull, permeated with magic which can transform into a physical animal. Upon speaking an activation word, the skull transforms into the animal it came from (cat, dog, bird, or serpent). The animal responds to your mental commands as long as you are within 50m, and will act like a regular animal of its kind should you give it no commands. Upon death, the animal reverts to an inert crystal skull. The Crystal Skull can be recharged by performing the Create Crystal Skull ritual (see pg.102) using only 2 units of Fifth Essence and the inactive skull. The animal summoned from a skull is always the same animal.

Education DC:16 to determine nature.

Diagram: Centerpiece.name: Diagram: Centerpiece
Diagram: Centerpiece.description: To create a Centerpiece, you must use the Fine Arts skill to create an entirely unique item of great complexity. The Centerpiece must include at least 3 different materials and the total investment cost must be at least 700 Crowns. Each summoning must have a different Centerpiece.

Diagram: True Staff of Binding.name: Diagram: True Staff of Binding
Diagram: True Staff of Binding.description: Alternative Receipe: Staff of Binding, Meteorite (x3), Optima Matter (x2)

Diagram: Witcher’s Medallion.name: Diagram: Witcher’s Medallion
Diagram: Witcher’s Medallion.description: Witcher Medallions must be made in a specific way by a mage. A mage can craft a medallion with a unit of silver but afterward they must take it to a Place of Power to absorb magic. After being left  at that Place of Power for an hour it will function as a witcher medallion. No other benefits can be gained from the Place of Power while priming.

Distillation Chamber.name: Distillation Chamber
Distillation Chamber.description: A complex set of tubes and chambers which can be used with any alchemical ingredient to increase its potency. By taking 1 hour, the user can place up to 10 units of an alchemical ingredient into the Distillation Chamber and make a DC:14 Alchemy check. If successful, the Distillation Chamber transforms the ingredients into an equal number of units of the pure substance.

Dwarven Whetstone.name: Dwarven Whetstone
Dwarven Whetstone.description: By taking half an hour, the user can grant one Slashing or Piercing weapon (or 10 arrows/bolts) the Armor Piercing Effect for the next combat. A Dwarven Whetstone can be applied 3 times before being consumed.

Earthly Ribbons.name: Earthly Ribbons
Earthly Ribbons.description: A length of beautiful silk ribbon, embroidered with runes made from thread infused with fifth essence. When a goetic practitioner summons a mari lwyd they can present these ribbons among the gifts to the demon. The mari lwyd will happily accept the gorgeous gift and allow the practitioner to tie the ribbons around them. Once bound by Earthly Ribbons a mari lwyd is incapable of taking other forms. Once tied, the Earthly Ribbons remain active for 1 year. After this year, the ribbons lose their magic. Before that year ends however, the ribbons can be removed by anyone other than the mari lwyd.

Elemental.name: Elemental
Elemental.minorMutation: Earth: Rocky growths on body, Fire: Small spouts of fire from your mouth, Ice: Cold to the touch

Elven Gedwch.name: Elven Gedwch
Elven Gedwch.description: Made popular by the Dyn Marv caravan, these intricate wagons of elven make are often lavishly decorated. Their construction makes them sturdy enough to withstand the rough byroads of the Continent and there’s room inside for a double bed and a small table. Occupancy: 3; IS: 5

Elven Instrument.name: Elven Instrument
Elven Instrument.description: Made with ancient elven crafting techniques, this Lyre, lute, or Flute carries a small amount of magic in it. When the user plays this instrument, the user can make a performance check against the Resist Magic check of a target who can hear their performance to enthrall them. If they succeed, the target can only focus on the user and takes a -2 to any action that would draw their attention away from them. Each round, the user must use an action to continue playing and the target can use their action to attempt another Resist Magic roll to end the effect. If they leave the area of the performance the effect ends immediately.

Enchanted Amulet.name: Enchanted Amulet
Enchanted Amulet.description:
Counts as a Focus (2) item. In addition, the creator of an enchanted amulet may imbue it with the power to cast 1 to 4 spells. The magic inside the amulet draws on the wearer’s stamina to activate the spells and the wearer must have a Vigor Threshold high enough to cast a spell from the amulet. When casting the spells from an enchanted amulet, the wearer cannot make use of any focus other than the amulet to lower the stamina cost. Additionally, an enchanted amulet can allow priests & druids to cast spells as if they were a mage.

Once more than one spell has been imbued in the amulet, the creator must also choose a drawback from the following list. These drawbacks remain as long as the enchanted amulet is worn, and for 24-hours afterward.
The drawbacks can be:
◆ The wearer’s maximum Hit Points are reduced by 5.
◆ The wearer experiences a constant headache giving them a -1 to INT, WILL, and REF.
◆ The wearer fatigues more easily and reduces their maximum Stamina by 10.

Education DC:14 to determine nature.

Endurance Potion.name: Endurance Potion
Endurance Potion.effect: Regain 3d6 Stamina. The Toxicity of the endurance potion lasts until its duration  elapses regardless of whether the Stamina is used.

Extra Enhancement Slot.name: Extra Enhancement Slot
Extra Enhancement Slot.description: A craftsman can add an empty enhancement slot to a weapon or piece of armor. The item in question must be at its full Reliability or Stopping Power value, the craftsman must have a set of Crafting Tools and the Enhancement Slot Diagram. With these prerequisites met, the craftsman can spend 4 hours to roll a Crafting check to attempt to add an enhancement slot to the item. This new enhancement slot can only hold runes or glyphs, and an item can only have a maximum of 3 enhancement slots.

Eye of Nehaleni.name: Eye of Nehaleni
Eye of Nehaleni.description:
Eyes of Nehaleni are rare magical objects that have begun to resurface in the last decade. These round stone tablets have inscriptions of a complex variation of the symbol of Nehaleni, the Nordling goddess of fate & illusion. Holding the tablet aloft and calling to the goddess allows a person to attempt to dispel illusions.

By taking an action you can make a Spell Casting check with a +4 bonus against the original check made to create the illusion or a DC set by the GM. If you succeed, the illusion ends. The Eye of Nehaleni does not require you to spend any Stamina to dispel an illusion.

Education DC:16 to determine nature.

False Coins.name: False Coins
False Coins.description: Requires a DC:15 Awareness/Business check to spot they are fake

Fine Art Tools.name: Fine Art Tools
Fine Art Tools.description: Allows you to create a form of art (Painting, Jewelry, sculpture, etc.)

Fisstech.name: Fisstech
Fisstech.effect:
Sends those who snort it or rub it on their gums into a euphoric trance-like state. It is often used as an anesthetic, as it numbs pain. It is highly addictive.

After each use, make an Endurance check at DC:18. If you fail, you become addicted. See pg.32 for addiction rules. A user must make a DC:16 Endurance check or be stunned for up to half an hour. Users can attempt another check each round, but a roll below 10 on any check causes unconciousness for 5 rounds.

Foglet.name: Foglet
Foglet.minorMutation: A weak internal glow & gaunt features

Forgar’s Guide.name: Forgar’s Guide
Forgar’s Guide.description: A pocket-sized leather journal with information about the plants and minerals of the Continent. When referenced while foraging for an ingredient, the Forager’s Guide lowers the DC to forage by 2 and increases the number of units found by the foraging check by 2.

Forgery Kit.name: Forgery Kit
Forgery Kit.description: Allows you to make false coins & false documents

Formula: Arachas Decoction.name: Formula: Arachas Decoction
Formula: Arachas Decoction.description: When creating a decoction, you must mix all of the ingredients listed below with 1 unit of mutagen from the appropriate monster and 1 bottle of spirits.

Formula: Fiend Decoction.name: Formula: Fiend Decoction
Formula: Fiend Decoction.description: When creating a decoction, you must mix all of the ingredients listed below with 1 unit of mutagen from the appropriate monster and 1 bottle of spirits.

Formula: Grave Hag Decoction.name: Formula: Grave Hag Decoction
Formula: Grave Hag Decoction.description: When creating a decoction, you must mix all of the ingredients listed below with 1 unit of mutagen from the appropriate monster and 1 bottle of spirits.

Formula: Griffin Decoction.name: Formula: Griffin Decoction
Formula: Griffin Decoction.description: When creating a decoction, you must mix all of the ingredients listed below with 1 unit of mutagen from the appropriate monster and 1 bottle of spirits.

Formula: Katakan Decoction.name: Formula: Katakan Decoction
Formula: Katakan Decoction.description: When creating a decoction, you must mix all of the ingredients listed below with 1 unit of mutagen from the appropriate monster and 1 bottle of spirits.

Formula: Nekker Decoction.name: Formula: Nekker Decoction
Formula: Nekker Decoction.description: When creating a decoction, you must mix all of the ingredients listed below with 1 unit of mutagen from the appropriate monster and 1 bottle of spirits.

Formula: Noon Wraith Decoction.name: Formula: Noon Wraith Decoction
Formula: Noon Wraith Decoction.description: When creating a decoction, you must mix all of the ingredients listed below with 1 unit of mutagen from the appropriate monster and 1 bottle of spirits.

Formula: Troll Decoction.name: Formula: Troll Decoction
Formula: Troll Decoction.description: When creating a decoction, you must mix all of the ingredients listed below with 1 unit of mutagen from the appropriate monster and 1 bottle of spirits.

Formula: Werewolf Decoction.name: Formula: Werewolf Decoction
Formula: Werewolf Decoction.description: When creating a decoction, you must mix all of the ingredients listed below with 1 unit of mutagen from the appropriate monster and 1 bottle of spirits.

Formula: Wyvern Decoction.name: Formula: Wyvern Decoction
Formula: Wyvern Decoction.description: When creating a decoction, you must mix all of the ingredients listed below with 1 unit of mutagen from the appropriate monster and 1 bottle of spirits.

Four-Leaf Clover.name: Four-Leaf Clover
Four-Leaf Clover.description:
A four-leaf clover grants a temporary +1 to your Luck. Without taking an action, you can expend this FourLeaf Clover to gain a +1 to your next check. Once this point has been used, the clover disintegrates.

Education DC:10 to determine nature.

Full Moon.name: Full Moon
Full Moon.effect: Grants you +30 temporary Health Points until the end of the duration. Full Moon potions do not stack with one another.

Gilding.name: Gilding
Gilding.description: Grants a +1 Reputation bonus. A character can only benefit from one such bonus at a time.

Goat Skin Mantle.name: Goat Skin Mantle
Goat Skin Mantle.description:
A treated goat skin mantle that hangs around the shoulders and clasps at the front with bone toggles. Goat Skin Mantles have several unique effects when summoning various forms of demons and are used as a first line of defense by goetic practitioners. The only person who benefits from the effects of a Goat Skin Mantle is the person wearing it.

Bes: Unless the summoner is wearing a Goat Skin Mantle, the bes will immediately try to possess them upon its summoning. This happens before anyone can take an action.

Casglydd: Unless the summoner is wearing a Goat Skin Mantle, the casglydd will immediately try to use its Claw attack to drag them into the shadows where it will negotiate on its terms. This happens before anyone can take an action.

Mari Lwyd: Unless the summoner is wearing a Goat Skin Mantle, the mari lwyd will assume that everything present in the building where the summoning takes place is part of the summoner’s offering.


Education DC:18 to determine nature.

Golden Oriole.name: Golden Oriole
Golden Oriole.effect: Grants immunity to poisons and neutralizes any poisons in your system.

Grave Hag Decoction.name: Grave Hag Decoction
Grave Hag Decoction.effect: +2 HP regeneration for every enemy slain during combat. This health bonus lasts until the end of the combat.

Griffin Decoction.name: Griffin Decoction
Griffin Decoction.effect: Every time you take more than 5 points of damage you gain +2 SP. This SP applies to all locations and stacks with itself.

Hallucinogen.name: Hallucinogen
Hallucinogen.effect:
Can be thrown on a target within 3m or slipped into a drink. If the target fails a DC:15 Endurance check, they start hallucinating. These hallucinations last for 1d10 rounds.


Throwing it is an Athletics attack with a range equal to your BODYx2m, and the acid splatters in a 2m cone directly away from where it lands.

High Tension String.name: High Tension String
High Tension String.description: Adds +1d6 to the damage of the crossbow.

Holy Symbol.name: Holy Symbol
Holy Symbol.description: +2 Charisma with followers of a certain faitch.

Ice Skates.name: Ice Skates
Ice Skates.description:
While ice skating, you ignore the effects of Snow and Ice 
conditions. Treat ice skating as being mounted on a horse with a +2 Control Modifier and a SPD of 12 that is incapable of charging or ramming.

Improved Windlass.name: Improved Windlass
Improved Windlass.description: Allows you to spend either an Action or a Movement Action to reload the crossbow.

Interior: Secure Storage.name: Interior: Secure Storage
Interior: Secure Storage.description: A locked compartment in the floor of the wagon can hold up to 80kg worth of items. The compartment comes with a Standard Lock and key.

Interior: Workshop.name: Interior: Workshop
Interior: Workshop.description: This section of the wagon is set up to aid in the use of a single Crafting Skill. Pick one of the following: Alchemy, Crafting, Disguise, First Aid, or Forgery. This workshop is considered to have all the tools required for that Skill and grants a +2 Bonus to Skill checks of that type.

Investigator’s Helper.name: Investigator’s Helper
Investigator’s Helper.effect: When sprayed on an area where blood was present, the fluid turns black, revealing the presence of blood. A container of Investigator’s Helper can be applied 10 times before being consumed.

Invisible Ink.name: Invisible Ink
Invisible Ink.effect: Allows you to write messages that can only be read when exposed to heat for 1 turn.

Jar of Leeches.name: Jar of Leeches
Jar of Leeches.effect: Leeches grant a +3 bonus to Endurance for removing the Poisoned condition.
Jar of Leeches.description: +3 bonus to Endurance for removing the Poisoned condition

Katakan Decoction.name: Katakan Decoction
Katakan Decoction.effect: You gain a +3 to your roll when determining the location of a critical wound.

Killer Whale.name: Killer Whale
Killer Whale.effect: Grants immunity to poisons and neutralizes any poisons in your system.

Lantern.name: Lantern
Lantern.description: Raises light levels by 2 for 3m all around

Lantern, Bullseye.name: Lantern, Bullseye
Lantern, Bullseye.description: Raises light levels by 3 within a 5m cone

Last Hope.name: Last Hope
Last Hope.effect: Last Hope can repair the most grievous wounds at a cost. Drinking it treats 1 critical wound the drinker has but that critical wound will not heal unless a Doctor makes a DC:24 Healing Hands check to reapply the critical wound and then treats it again with Healing Hands.

Lightning.name: Lightning
Lightning.effect: Grants the drinker a +3 damage on your next physical attack.

Lintar.name: Lintar
Lintar.description:
= 2 Redanian Crowns
Used in The Hengfors League

Lock, Trapped.name: Lock, Trapped
Lock, Trapped.description: A complex, mechanical lock fitted with a needle which the user can load with a vial of poison. Picking the lock requires a DC:17 Pick Lock check. If the character fails to pick the lock, the needle in the lock juts out, stabbing into the hand of the thief, inflicting the effects of the poison loaded into the lock. Once sprung a Trapped Lock must be reloaded with a new vial of poison.

Magic Compass.name: Magic Compass
Magic Compass.description:
An enchanted compass which can point the user towards an object they have a clear and accurate mental image of. By taking an action, a character holding a Magic Compass can make a Resist Coercion check at a DC set by the Game Master to clear their mind of any distractions and visualize an object they have seen before. If the character succeeds, the compass points in the direction of the item they were thinking of. If they fail it points in the direction of some other thing the holder desires.


Education DC:12 to determine nature.

Magical Elven Rope.name: Magical Elven Rope
Magical Elven Rope.description:
The rope can twist and cling to people reaching out for it, tie itself around objects that it is laid on, and retract back to the holder. While the rope is capable of tying itself around people, it never does this fast enough to grapple a resisting creature. When climbing with this rope, you gain a +5 bonus to Athletics checks made to climb. Finally, the rope, despite is delicate nature, is nigh unbreakable, able to support 300kg of weight and take 50 points of damage.

Education DC:18 to determine nature.

Manacles.name: Manacles
Manacles.description: Escaping manacles requires a DC:16 Pick Locks check, and escaping shackles takes a DC:20 Pick Locks check. If you want to break your way out of manacles or shackles, you’ll have to make a Physique check. The DC for breaking manacles is 18, while the DC for breaking shackles is 22.

Maribor Forest.name: Maribor Forest
Maribor Forest.effect: Each time you gain an adrenaline die, add a second one.

Medical Censer.name: Medical Censer
Medical Censer.description: A covered metal brazier on a chain which disperses smoke across an area. A Medical Censer can be loaded with single type of Alchemical Item and lit to spread their effects through infused smoke or steam. The effects of an Alchemical Item placed into a Medical Censer affect every creature within 6m of the Censer including the person holding the censer. The Alchemical Item burns for 1 round for each unit placed in the censer. The Alchemical Items that can be used with an Alchemical Censer are: Adda’s Tomb, Base Powder, Chloroform, Clotting Powder, Hallucinogen, Numbing Herbs, Pantagran’s Elixir, Perfume Potion, Sterilizing Fluid, Succubus’ Breath, and Wives’ Tears Potion.

Megascope.name: Megascope
Megascope.description:
A Megascope must be arranged in a wide circle on a flat surface and activated by a person with a Vigor Threshold of at least 1. No special ritual is required to activate a Megascope. Once activated the Megascope can be used in one of two ways. Firstly, the Megascope can be used to contact another person with a Megascope or Telecommunicator. There is no earthly limit to the distance of communication, but a Megascope cannot facilitate communication with things beyond the dimension in which it is used. The recipient of the communication can choose to answer the communication; in which case the Megascope creates a spectral form of the recipient within the circle, allowing communication as if the participants were in the same room. Secondly, a Megascope can, with a DC:16 Spell Casting check, be used to view a person the user has a strong emotional connection to. If the person being viewed is a mage they can sense the augury if they roll a Magic Training check that beats your initial Spell Casting check, but they cannot see who is spying on them. This remote viewing can be maintained for up to 10 minutes before the connection fades and the user must keep all of their focus on the megascope.

Additionally, once a connection has been established, a Megascope can act as a channel for teleportation. While your Megascope is connected to or remotely viewing a person, you can cast the Teleportation or Standing Portal spells to transport yourself to that location. If using teleportation, there is no Spell Casting check required to teleport. Unfortunately, the complex nature of the Megascope means that it must be in perfect working order for it to be safely utilized. If one of the Gemstones in a Megascope is damaged in even the slightest way the Megascope becomes unstable. A gemstone can be damaged by being struck, knocked out of the Megascope, scratched, or anything else that might mar its perfect surface. Additionally, due to the highly magical nature of a Megascope, bringing any amount of Dimeritium within 3m of a Megascope will damage all the Gemstones at a nearly imperceptible level.

If this happens while you are communicating with someone or you attempt to activate the Megascope with a damaged or imperfect gemstone, the image just become a bit shakier than usual requiring a DC:20 Awareness check to notice. However, the real danger comes when trying to remotely view a target or teleport through a damaged Megascope. If you attempt to remotely view a target through a damaged Megascope the DC raises to 25 and if you fail to beat this check any damaged gemstones in the Megascope explode, dealing 1d6 damage to every location on the body of anyone within 4m. This renders the Megascope useless until the Perfect Gemstones can be replaced. If you attempt to teleport through a damaged Megascope far worse things happen. If you cast the Standing Portal Spell with a damaged Megascope, the spell automatically fails as though you had rolled a fumble with a value of 10 and all 3 Gemstones in the Megascope will explode, dealing 3d6 damage to every location on the body of anyone within 6m. If you attempt to cast the Teleportation spell within a damaged Megascope the magic begins to rend you apart violently. Anyone within the range of their SPD Statistic has one chance to make a DC:14 Athletics check to remove the damaged crystal before your body is torn apart and the individual pieces lie scattered across the Continent. If they succeed, the Megascope powers down and you are unharmed. If they fail, you die a messy death.

Education DC:14 to determine nature.

Merchant Wagon.name: Merchant Wagon
Merchant Wagon.description: Sometimes called Ofieri wagons, from the birthplace of this wagon’s design, these vehicles are among the most common sight in Nilfgaard and the North. They’re often driven by sturdy oxen rather than horses and serve as a home away from home for many a merchant. Occupancy: 1; IS: 3

Military Saddlebags.name: Military Saddlebags
Military Saddlebags.description: Rugged saddlebags that have enough room to carry 50kg of small or medium items in each of the two bags, with straps for up to 6 large items on the outside.

Miniature War Table.name: Miniature War Table
Miniature War Table.description:
A wooden box containing a set of iron markers, reference texts, maps, and historical records which help a character to predict the flow of a battle. By taking 10 minutes, a character can lay out the battle ahead to the best of their knowledge and make a Tactics check at a DC set by the Game Master. If they succeed they can ask the Game Master three of the following questions about the upcoming battle and they must answer truthfully:

• What will the enemies first move be?
• What is our best approach to this battle? 
• Is there an element of the environment we can use to our benefit?
• How will our enemy likely react to a certain plan?
• Are there any aspects of the environment that our enemy might use against us? 
• Is the enemy likely to have set up traps?

Mongoose.name: Mongoose
Mongoose.effect: Renders the drinker immune to the poisoned condition for 30 minutes.

Monkshood Poison.name: Monkshood Poison
Monkshood Poison.effect:
Can be slipped into food and drink. Monkshood Poison immediately causes the target to suffer the Suffocating Condition as they suffer tremendous respiratory issues.

To end the Suffocating condition, the target must make a DC:20 Endurance check or someone must make a DC:20 First Aid Check. It takes a DC:16 Awareness check to realize the food is poisoned.

Moon Blade (Silver Long Sword, Education.name: Moon Blade (Silver Long Sword, Education DC: 18)

Mountain Folk Armor (Medium Armor, Educa.name: Mountain Folk Armor (Medium Armor, Education DC: 16)

Muzzle.name: Muzzle
Muzzle.effect: Make a Melee attack to disarm a creature’s Bite attack until it takes an action and removes the muzzle with a DC:16 Sleight of Hand/Physique check
Muzzle.description: Make a Melee attack to disarm a creature’s Bite attack until it takes an action and removes the muzzle with a DC:16 Sleight of Hand/Physique check.

Nekker Decoction.name: Nekker Decoction
Nekker Decoction.effect: Your mount never panics and you gain a +3 to all Ride and Athletics checks.

Nilfgaardian Floren.name: Nilfgaardian Floren
Nilfgaardian Floren.description:
= 3 Redanian Crowns
Used in Nilfgaard and Nilfgaardian Provinces

Nilfgaardian Sights.name: Nilfgaardian Sights
Nilfgaardian Sights.description: Adds +1 to the crossbow’s Weapon Accuracy.

Noon Wraith Decoction.name: Noon Wraith Decoction
Noon Wraith Decoction.effect: You gain immunity to Stun & Blindness and cannot be knocked prone.

Numbing Herbs.name: Numbing Herbs
Numbing Herbs.effect: Placed in a wound relieve pain, lowering negatives from critical wounds by 2. Numbing herbs also lessen penalties from being near death by 2. Numbing herbs work for 2d10 rounds, and then you can apply another dose.

Pair of Braces.name: Pair of Braces
Pair of Braces.description: A pair of sturdy wooden and metal braces that can be applied to a piece of cover by taking a full round action. Once applied, the braces grant an additional 3 points of SP to the Cover. The braces can be removed by taking another full round action. The bracers are destroyed if the cover is destroyed. Only one pair of braces can be added to a piece of cover at a time.

Pantagran’s Elixir.name: Pantagran’s Elixir
Pantagran’s Elixir.effect: Brings delirious happiness. This effect lasts for 1d6/2 hours and leaves the imbiber incredibly suceptible to Persuasion, Charisma, and Seduction, giving them a -2 to Resist Coercion.

Perfume Potion.name: Perfume Potion
Perfume Potion.effect: Imbiber must make a DC:16 Endurance check. Failure causes intoxication for 1d10 Hours. This intoxication can only be undone by magic or wives’ tears potion.

Petri’s Filter.name: Petri’s Filter
Petri’s Filter.effect: +2 point in Spellcasting, Hex Weaving, and Ritual Crafting

Phoenix.name: Phoenix
Phoenix.minorMutation: Patches of grey feathers & an internal glow

Plague Mask.name: Plague Mask
Plague Mask.description: Grants a +3 bonus to Endurance to resist airborne illness, poison, and nausea when worn.

Pocketed Cloak.name: Pocketed Cloak
Pocketed Cloak.effect: Contains 6 secret pockets placed throughout the cloak.
Pocketed Cloak.description: Contains 6 secret pockets placed throughout the cloak.

Poisoner’s Friend.name: Poisoner’s Friend
Poisoner’s Friend.effect: Poisoner’s friend is a clear liquid that can be poured into food or drink to give it a potent savory or sweet taste. This raises the DC to detect poison to 20.

Poisonous Lipcoloring.name: Poisonous Lipcoloring
Poisonous Lipcoloring.effect:
One application of this lipstick stays potent for 1 hour. The next person the user kisses during that time period,  immediately suffers the Poisoned Condition with the following differences: The target is also Intoxicated for the duration of the Poison.

A container of Poisonous Lipcoloring can be applied 3 times before being consumed.

Potestaquisitor.name: Potestaquisitor
Potestaquisitor.description:
A handheld device which can detect magical disturbances within 20m. The Potestaquisitor lets out a hum that escalates into a squeal as  the user gets closer to the disturbance. The Potestaquisitor can detect the presence of Dark Magic including hexes, curses, cursed items, and demons, as well as specters, dimeritium, true dragons, and cats.


Education DC:14 to determine nature.

Power Stone Guardian.name: Power Stone Guardian
Power Stone Guardian.description:
These sculpted gems are enchanted to protect an area from intruders. While the power stone itself is a small gemstone, it can be placed in a variety of settings. Power Stone Guardians can take many forms such as doors, statues, or even chandeliers. The consensus seems to be that a power stone guardian must be made from an object sturdy enough to resist accidental destruction. The power stone within this object emits a faint magical aura that becomes stronger the closer it is, meaning that a mage can detect one with Magic Training and a Witcher’s Medallion will vibrate when near one.

A power stone needs to be attuned to someone. The creator of this object can attune it to someone else, who then has the power to attune it to others by placing their hands on the stone. In large cities, you will find that almost all noble houses are guarded by Power Stone Guardians of some form and even some middle class residences may have one guarding their valuables. There are as many types of power stone guardians as there are paranoid mages, but the three presented here are the most common.

◆ Alarm Power Stone: When an unattuned creature moves within 6m of the stone, it sends a telepathic message to those attuned to it. The stone can only alert the attuned creatures that someone has entered the area but cannot tell them who the intruders are. 
◆ Arcing Power Stone: When an unattuned creature comes within 6m of the stone, it immediately rolls an attack at a base 10 to release a small bolt of lightning that deals 2d6 damage. This attack can be dodged or blocked with a shield. After this point the Arcing Power Stone enters the initiative order at the bottom and attacks every round so long as an unattuned person remains in the area. 
◆ Illusion Power Stone: When an unattuned creature comes within 2m of the stone, the magic inside creates an illusory guard who appears to have just come onto the scene within 10m. The guard is dressed and armed in the manner dictated when the power stone is created. The illusion can shout a short phrase and can move about within 10m of the stone. The illusion cannot interact with anything otherwise, nor can it damage anything. The illusion lasts for 8 hours, or until dispelled.

Education DC:16 to determine nature.

Prosthetic, Basic.name: Prosthetic, Basic
Prosthetic, Basic.description: While wearing a Basic Prosthesis, the limb has a full range of mobility and function, and any reduction to SPD is negated. Due to its lack of fine motor function, all attack and defense checks made with a prosthetic arm are made at a -3. In the case of a Basic Prosthetic Leg, all Dodge/Escape checks are made at a -1. Additionally, a Basic Prosthesis cannot be used to channel Chaos. Any attack made against a prosthetic limb is redirected towards its wearer for gameplay purposes.

Prosthetic, Conduit.name: Prosthetic, Conduit
Prosthetic, Conduit.description: While wearing a Conduit Prosthesis, the limb has a full range of mobility and function, and any reduction to SPD is negated. A Conduit Prosthesis can be used to channel Chaos through magical sigils carved into the length, inlaid with optima matter and fifth essence and acts as a Focus (2) with the Greater Focus effect. Any attack made against a prosthetic limb is redirected towards its wearer for gameplay purposes.

Prosthetic, Magical.name: Prosthetic, Magical
Prosthetic, Magical.description: While wearing a Magical Prosthesis, the limb has a full range of mobility and function, and any reduction to SPD is negated. Additionally, a Magical Prosthesis cannot be used to channel Chaos. Any attack made against a prosthetic limb is redirected towards its wearer for gameplay purposes.

Prosthetic, Quality.name: Prosthetic, Quality
Prosthetic, Quality.description: While wearing a Prosthesis, the limb has a full range of mobility and function, and any reduction to SPD is negated. Due to its lack of fine motor function, all attack and defense checks made with a prosthetic arm are made at a -3. In the case of a Prosthetic Leg, all Dodge/Escape checks are made at a -1. Additionally, a Basic Prosthesis cannot be used to channel Chaos. Any attack made against a prosthetic limb is redirected towards its wearer for gameplay purposes.

Prosthetic, Witcher.name: Prosthetic, Witcher
Prosthetic, Witcher.description: While wearing a Witcher Prosthesis, the limb has a full range of mobility and function, and any reduction to SPD is negated. A Witcher Prosthesis can be used to channel Chaos via magical sigils carved into the length, infused fifth essence similar to a magic amulet. Silver knuckles and toe caps add 1d6 silver damage to any punch or kick made with a Witcher Prosthesis. Any attack made against a prosthetic limb is redirected towards its wearer for gameplay purposes.

Quick Fire.name: Quick Fire
Quick Fire.effect: Poured on a person, surface, or object, dries quickly. Anything so treated is extremely flammable. There’s a 50% chance it will ignite each time it’s exposed to flame or sparks of any kind.

Racing Saddle.name: Racing Saddle
Racing Saddle.description:
+1 to Control checks for Riding
+1 SPD

Redanian Crown.name: Redanian Crown
Redanian Crown.description: most merchants recognize and accept the Redanian crown

Ring of Favor.name: Ring of Favor
Ring of Favor.description:
A seemingly magic ring crafted from silver and gold and inlaid with magical sigils. Once per session, a character wearing the Ring of Favor can roll 1d10. On a result of 1, 5, or 10, the character regains all of the Luck Points they’ve expended during this session.


Education DC:14 to determine nature.

Runewright’s Tools.name: Runewright’s Tools
Runewright’s Tools.description:
A set of Runewright’s Tools is required to craft runewords and glyphwords. Additionally, taking ½ hour to etch a rune or glyph into an item with a set of Runewright’s Tools grants an additional benefit based on the 
rune or glyph:

◆ Chemobog Rune: Your weapon only takes damage if the value rolled is a 1 or 2.
◆ Dazhbog Rune: The chance of Fire raises to 40%.
◆ Devana Rune: The chance of Bleed raises to 40%.
◆ Morana Rune: The chance of Poison raises to 40%.
◆ Perun Rune: Each time you use an Adrenaline Die, if the valued rolled is a 1 you keep the die.
◆ Stribog Rune: The chance of Stagger raises to 40%.
◆ Svarog Rune: Instead of Armor Piercing, your weapon gains Improved Armor Piercing.
◆ Triglav Rune: The penalty to Stun raises by 1.
◆ Veles Rune: The weapon also gains the Focus (1) effect.
◆ Zoria Rune: The chance of Freeze raises to 40%.
◆ Glyph of Earth: The bonus to Spell DC raises by 1.
◆ Glyph of Air: The bonus to Spell DC raises by 1.
◆ Glyph of Fire: The bonus to Spell DC raises by 1.
◆ Glyph of Water: The bonus to Spell DC raises by 1.
◆ Glyph of Magic: The bonus to Spell DC raises by 1.
◆ Glyph of Mending: The additional Health Points gained raises to 2.
◆ Glyph of Reinforcement: The additional Stopping Power raises by 1.
◆ Glyph of Warding: You gain a +1 to Resist Magic while wearing this armor.
◆ Glyph of Binding: The penalty to the chance of bleeding raises to -40%.

Education DC:16 to determine nature.

Saddlebags.name: Saddlebags
Saddlebags.description: Saddlebags have enough room to carry 25kg of small or medium items in each of the two bags.

Secret Pocket.name: Secret Pocket
Secret Pocket.description: 5kg of tiny items (DC:16 Awareness to notice)

Shackles.name: Shackles
Shackles.description: Escaping manacles requires a DC:16 Pick Locks check, and escaping shackles takes a DC:20 Pick Locks check. If you want to break your way out of manacles or shackles, you’ll have to make a Physique check. The DC for breaking manacles is 18, while the DC for breaking shackles is 22.

Shaelmaar.name: Shaelmaar
Shaelmaar.minorMutation: Patches of thick rock textured skin

Shepherd’s Hut.name: Shepherd’s Hut
Shepherd’s Hut.description: These wagons originated from Aedirn, where they’re used as temporary homes for shepherds during the raising and lambing of their flocks. They’re solid and can withstand much but their bulk makes them unwieldy and hard to maneuver. Occupancy: 4; IS: 2

Siding: Barbed Siding.name: Siding: Barbed Siding
Siding: Barbed Siding.description: A character who attempts to climb onto the wagon must make a DC:16 Athletics check or take 3d6 damage to an appropriate hit location and be forced to let go.

Siding: Hardened Siding.name: Siding: Hardened  Siding
Siding: Hardened Siding.description: +10 Vehicle SP. This Enhancement does not stack with Iron Siding.

Siding: Iron Siding.name: Siding: Iron Siding
Siding: Iron Siding.description: +20 Vehicle SP. This Enhancement does not stack with Hardened Siding.

Signal Horn.name: Signal Horn
Signal Horn.description: A signal horn can be heard for about a mile away.

Signal Whistle.name: Signal Whistle
Signal Whistle.description: A signal horn can be heard for about half a mile away.

Skelliger Brace.name: Skelliger Brace
Skelliger Brace.description: Raises the crossbow’s Reliability by 5 and allows you to use it as a Bludgeoning Melee Weapon with a damage equivalent to it’s ranged damage and a -1 Weapon Accuracy.

Smelling Salts.name: Smelling Salts
Smelling Salts.effect: Can be placed under an unconcious or stunned person, or creature’s nose to immediately bring them out of their stunned state. Smelling salts can be used 25 times.

Sound Amplifier.name: Sound Amplifier
Sound Amplifier.description: A small metal horn which can be held to a surface such as a wall or a door to amplify any sound coming from the other side. When the user places their ear to the horn, they can hear any sounds coming from the other side of a moderately thick surface as if they were on the other side of the surface.

Spell Formula.name: Spell Formula
Spell Formula.description:
When using a spell formula, you gain +2 to your skill check to learn a specific spell, invocation, hex, sign, or ritual.

Price Novice: 100, Journeyman: 200, Master: 300

Education DC:14 to determine nature.

Stabilizing Brace.name: Stabilizing Brace
Stabilizing Brace.description: Grants the crossbow the Balanced Effect.

Sterilizing Fluid.name: Sterilizing Fluid
Sterilizing Fluid.effect: Poured on a wound raises the patient’s natural healing rate by 2 points and lessens the number of days a critical wound takes to heal by 2. Multiple uses of sterilizing fluid don’t stack.

Strider.name: Strider
Strider.effect: No need to sleep for 24 hours.

Succubus’ Breath.name: Succubus’ Breath
Succubus’ Breath.effect: Can be used to aid seduction. Used on the skin, it gives you a +2 to Seduction. If poured into someone’s drink, it gives them a -5 to Seduction Resistance. It takes a DC:16 Awareness check to realize there is succubus’ breath in a drink.

Summer Ointment.name: Summer Ointment
Summer Ointment.effect: When rubbed on the neck and wrists, Summer Ointment doubles the number of hours you can survive in extreme cold and lowers the penalty to STA from extreme heat to 1/4 your total STA.

Swallow.name: Swallow
Swallow.effect: Regenerate 3 points per round. In any round you are struck, you do not regenerate. This healing doesn’t stack with multiple uses.

Talgar’s Tears.name: Talgar’s Tears
Talgar’s Tears.effect:
Immediately freezes anything it is thrown on. If used on weapons, armor, or objects, those items take double ablation damage.

Throwing it is an Athletics attack with a range equal to your BODYx2m, and the liquid splatters in a 2m cone directly away from where it lands, freezing anything it hits.

Tawny Owl.name: Tawny Owl
Tawny Owl.effect: Each time you use a Recovery action to gain back STA, add an extra 2 points.

Telecommunicator.name: Telecommunicator
Telecommunicator.description: Allows you to communicate with the Telecommunication ritual.

Temerian Oren.name: Temerian Oren
Temerian Oren.description:
= 1 Redanian Crown
Used in Temeria, most of the Northern Kingdoms below the Pontar River

Tempest.name: Tempest
Tempest.effect: When making an attack or casting a spell that has a chance of inflicting the Fire, Freeze, or Prone effects, the percentage is increased by 10%.

The Moon Bow (Long Bow, Education DC: 17.name: The Moon Bow (Long Bow, Education DC: 17)

Tinker’s Forge.name: Tinker’s Forge
Tinker’s Forge.description: Allows you to forge weapons and armor anywhere

Torch.name: Torch
Torch.description: Raises light levels by 1 for 5m all around.

Troll Decoction.name: Troll Decoction
Troll Decoction.effect: You regenerate 5 Health Points per round.

Undercarriage: Deployment Chute.name: Undercarriage: Deployment  Chute
Undercarriage: Deployment Chute.description: This chute can be loaded with up to 1kg of items. As an action, a character inside the wagon can pull a lever, opening the bottom of the chute and causing its contents to spill out behind the wagon.

Undercarriage: Hidden Compartment.name: Undercarriage: Hidden Compartment
Undercarriage: Hidden Compartment.description: Adds a space underneath the wagon which can hold up to 80kg worth of items. This compartment remains hidden until a character checks under the wagon and makes a DC:16 Awareness check.

Venom Extract.name: Venom Extract
Venom Extract.forageLocation: Ghouls, grave hags, Endrega, arachasae, wyverns

Vial of Gut Worms.name: Vial of Gut Worms
Vial of Gut Worms.effect: After consuming the eggs the target must make a DC:16 Endurance check or be infest-ed by gut worms, which lower their STA by one-quarter and have a 25% chance of causing nausea whenever they eat. The nausea can only be ended by a DC:14 Endurance check. They must be removed with a DC:14 Healing Hands check
Vial of Gut Worms.description: After consuming the eggs the target must make a DC:16 Endurance check or be infested by gut worms, which lower their STA by one-quarter and have a 25% chance of causing nausea whenever they eat. The nausea can only be ended by a DC:14 Endurance check. They must be removed with a DC:14 Healing Hands check.

Vitality Potion.name: Vitality Potion
Vitality Potion.effect: Ignore the penalties of being in the Wound Threshold for the duration of the potion.

Wand of Banishment.name: Wand of Banishment
Wand of Banishment.description:
A hazel wand with a capped by etched dark steel and treated with ogre wax and ester grease. This wand can be used to temporarily banish a pecific 
demon from existence. The wielder must make a melee weapon attack against the demon which if successful deals no damage but banishes the demon back to its own realm for 24 hours. Each wand can only be used on one specific demon (whose name is carved into the wand) and has a 50% chance of breaking with each banishment. If used against a greater demon, the wand always breaks after the banishment.

War Wagon.name: War Wagon
War Wagon.description: If you want a mobile fortress, take a siege engine and gut the inside to create a war wagon. Their poor maneuverability makes them better suited for on-road than off. However, what they lack in speed they more than make up for in durability. They’ll keep going long after other wagons would be burning wrecks littering the road. Occupancy: 0; IS: 4

Werecat.name: Werecat
Werecat.minorMutation: Cat’s eyes and increased hair growth

Werewolf Decoction.name: Werewolf Decoction
Werewolf Decoction.effect: Running for long periods of time takes no stamina.

Wheelchair, Basic.name: Wheelchair, Basic
Wheelchair, Basic.description: While using a Basic Wheelchair, any reduction to SPD, Dodge/Escape and Athletics caused by a Critical Wound or pre-existing disability is negated. However, while using a Basic Wheelchair, any check involving swimming or climbing is made at a -3. Any attack made against a person in a wheelchair is directed toward them instead of the chair for gameplay purposes.

Wheelchair, Quality.name: Wheelchair, Quality
Wheelchair, Quality.description: While using a Quality Wheelchair, any reduction to SPD, Dodge/Escape and Athletics caused by a Critical Wound or pre-existing disability is negated. However, while using a Quality Wheelchair, any check involving swimming or climbing is made at a -1. Any attack made against a person in a wheelchair is directed toward them instead of the chair for gameplay purposes.

Wheels: Spiked.name: Wheels: Spiked
Wheels: Spiked.description: While driving the wagon, a character can make an attack check, using their Riding Skill, against a target adjacent to the wagon. This attack deals 4d6 damage.

White Honey.name: White Honey
White Honey.effect: Clears toxicity and removes all potion effects.

White Raffard’s Decoction.name: White Raffard’s Decoction
White Raffard’s Decoction.effect: Regenerate 1 point of Health per round for the duration of the potion.

Wishing Mirror.name: Wishing Mirror
Wishing Mirror.description:
A wishing mirror allows a person to view their deepest desires within. When looking through the mirror, the onlooker sees their ideal self-image in a location they’ve always dreamt of and owning all the property they’ve dreamt of owning. While looking into the mirror, a person falls into a trance of sorts, seeing themselves within the mirror, enjoying the bountiful life just beyond the glass. These visions quickly become addictive and after gazing into the mirror once, a viewer must make a Resist Magic check DC:18. On a failure, the viewer is compelled to look into the mirror for at least 1 hour every day. At the end of each period, the viewer can make a new Resist Magic check. On a failure, the duration increases by 1 hour for the next 24-hour period. On a success, the duration is lessened by 1 hour.

Additionally, for every day that the viewer succeeds in not looking at the mirror, the duration is lessened by 1 hour. When the duration becomes 0 hours, the viewer is no longer under the magic of the mirror. If the duration ever reaches 24 hours, the viewer can no longer withdraw their gaze from the mirror even for basic needs such as eating and drinking. Without help, they are liable to die.

If the mirror is destroyed while someone is under its sway, that person becomes sullen and depressive for a month afterwards. They feel as though their life itself has been shattered and nothing brings them even the smallest amount of joy. This imposes a -2 to all actions they attempt.

Education DC:16 to determine nature.

Witcher’s Medallion.name: Witcher’s Medallion
Witcher’s Medallion.description: Detect monsters, curses or spells in 20m radius; vibrates lightly.

Wives’ Tears Potion.name: Wives’ Tears Potion
Wives’ Tears Potion.effect: Negates the effects of intoxication. Immediately after drinking a dose of wives’ tears potion the imbiber sobers up.

Writing Kit.name: Writing Kit
Writing Kit.description: Allows you to write letters, notes, and such

Wyvern Decoction.name: Wyvern Decoction
Wyvern Decoction.effect: You gain +1 damage to your next strike after a successful strike. This +1 is cumulative, and goes up with each hit until the combat ends or you take damage.

Xenovox.name: Xenovox
Xenovox.description:
Allows a mage to communicate via the Xenovox.

Education DC:16 to determine nature.

Zerrikanian Fire.name: Zerrikanian Fire
Zerrikanian Fire.effect:
Immediately sets whatever it touches on fire.

Throwing it is an Athletics attack with a range equal to your BODYx2m, and the it splatters in a 2m cone away from where it lands, lighting anyone and anything in that area on fire.
